Algorithms for distributed systems. CS 141abc. 9 units (3-3-3); prerequisites: CS138 or equivalent. This laboratory course deals with applications of systematic design methods and theories for reasoning about the correctness and performance of concurrent programs. The first two terms require program development carried out individually or in groups of two, and the third term has a larger project carried out by a team. Aspects of communication protocols for static and mobile systems, distributed operating systems, and fault-tolerant systems are studied with a focus on systematic design to achieve reliability and performance.
